newsitem.title: ISRAEL: PLO police find body of missing Israeli taxi driver.
newsitem.headline: PLO police find body of missing Israeli taxi driver.

text.p: Palestinian police have found the body of a missing Israeli taxi driver in a well in PLO-ruled Jericho, police said on Saturday.
Israeli and Palestinian police said three Palestinians suspected of murdering 45-year-old Shmuel Ben-Baruch had been arrested by PLO forces.
Palestinian police said Ben-Baruch had been smashed in the head with a stone and stabbed in the neck with a screwdriver.

The Jerusalem-based driver's bloodstained taxi was found on Friday in a wadi in Aqabat Jabr refugee camp on the outskirts of Jericho which Israeli police said was used as a storehouse for stolen vehicles.
Israeli police said the Mercedes taxi had been sold to the storehouse's owner for 7,000 shekels ($2,000).
Israeli police praised their Palestinian counterparts for rapid action in arresting suspects and locating the body.
Palestinian police said the three suspects did not belong to any political organisation. Israeli police said they were investigating both criminal and ''nationalist'' motives for the killing.
Israeli-Palestinian tension has run high since a double suicide bombing killed 16 people, including the attackers, at a market in Jerusalem on July 30.
Israel has imposed a closure on the West Bank and Gaza Strip, barring tens of thousands of Palestinians from entering the Jewish state.
